intro: Capraria longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
